means: 使变得年轻，使恢复活力

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from re- 'again' + Latin juvenis 'young' + -ate, suggested by French rajeunir

entry.tran: 使年轻;使恢复青春;使恢复活力
entry.def: If something rejuvenates you, it makes you feel or look young again.

example.ex: Shelley was advised that the Italian climate would rejuvenate him...
example.tran: 有人建议雪莱去意大利，那里的天气会使他恢复活力。

example.ex: When it was time to leave and return to civilization we both felt rejuvenated...
example.tran: 当就要离开这里返回文明世界时，我们俩都觉得恢复了活力。

entry.tran: 使（组织、制度等）恢复活力;使更有效率
entry.def: If you rejuvenate an organization or system, you make it more lively and more efficient, for example by introducing new ideas.

example.ex: The government pushed through schemes to rejuvenate the inner cities...
example.tran: 政府大力推行改造内城贫民区的计划。

example.ex: They should concentrate on rejuvenating the existing vegetation, like grass and shrubs.
example.tran: 他们应该侧重于修整现有的绿化植被，比如草和灌木。

means.word_mean: 1. cause (a stream or river) to erode, as by an uplift of the land

sentences.sentence: "The contact with his grandchildren rejuvenated him"

means.word_mean: 4. return to life; get or give new life or energy;

sentences.sentence: "The week at the spa restored me"
"The old man rejuvenated when he became a grandfather"

auth_sentence.content: Technology that can trap and store carbon dioxide from coal-fired plants would rejuvenate older ones.
auth_sentence.res_content: Technology that can trap and store carbon dioxide from coal-fired plants would rejuvenate older ones.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Technology that can trap and store carbon dioxide from coal-fired plants would rejuvenate older ones.

auth_sentence.content: To rejuvenate the left-leaning party, Mr. Gandhi is trying to signal a break with the past.
auth_sentence.res_content: To rejuvenate the left-leaning party, Mr. Gandhi is trying to signal a break with the past.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To rejuvenate the left-leaning party, Mr. Gandhi is trying to signal a break with the past.

auth_sentence.content: Mark says I should cut off most of the tree and see if it can rejuvenate itself from the stub of the trunk.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mark says I should cut off most of the tree and see if it can rejuvenate itself from the stub of the trunk.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mark says I should cut off most of the tree and see if it can rejuvenate itself from the stub of the trunk.

stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+juven年轻+escent开始……的→重新开始年轻
juven年轻+ile表名词→n.青少年,少年读物

juven年轻+ility=ity表名词→n.年轻, 不成熟
re重新+juven儿童+ate表动词→重新成儿童

Sentence.sentence: To tackle the problem of ageing populations at its root, "old" countries would have to rejuvenate (使.轻) themselves by having more of their own children.

means.word_mean: 使变得年轻, 使恢复活力

sentences.en: The mountain air will rejuvenate you.
sentences.cn: 山里的空气会使你恢复活力。
